formattedAddress: 43 W 22nd St, New York, NY 10010, USA
adrFormatAddress: 43 W 22nd St, New York, NY 10010, USA

originalText.text: My daughter attended Manhattan Village Academy school , I had to transfer her out of this school, if I wanted my daughter to have a bright future. Before she started to attend this school my daughter was always into school. I started to notice she had more free time on her hands, I would ask her , "did you do your homework" and she would replied "I didn't get no homework.". This continue so, I decided to go meet with the principal and he said that they really didn't give much homework but, that they were going to start giving homework that only lasted a few weeks . I decided that I had to transfer my daughter  out of Manhattan Village Academy. She then started to attend Baruch Campos HS which is an excellent school . My daughter graduated from Baruch Campos HS and she still keeps in touch with her classmates that also attended Baruch Campos HS . She has attended their college graduation, their weddings , and baby showers. To conclude Manhattan Village Academy isn't a school that would prepare you for college . My daughter after graduating from Baruch Campus HS was accepted to go to Humter College and then went on to NYU graduating as a Register Nurse from NYU.
